intro: Luvunga philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine luvunga, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
